page.title: 01Holm, Lamb Holm & Holm Sound
page.content: This area is at the south end of Holm on the East mainland of Orkney. Holm Sound was until world war two one of the entrances to the naval anchorage of Scapa Flow. This entrance was blocked off by the construction of the Churchhill Barriers between Holm and Burray. Italian prisioners were used for the construction and they were responsible for the building of the Italion chapel on Lamb Holm, by converting one of the prision huts, this is now preserved and is a popular tourist attraction. A salmon farm is under construction on Lamb Holm served by fish pens 1/4 of shore. the area of Holm is intensively farmed grassland for cattle and some sheep. the area is rich with wildlife, Holm Sound is popular for seals and is visited by many sea birds. It is also a good place for lobster fishing.
